label: Toxicity Filter
description: Filter honey compounds based on toxicity endpoints and safety thresholds.

defaultOutputs.name: hERG IC₅₀ (µM)
defaultOutputs.tooltip: hERG channel inhibition IC₅₀ (µM). Higher values indicate lower cardiac risk.

defaultOutputs.name: Ames Test (prob.)
defaultOutputs.tooltip: Ames test mutagenicity probability (0-1). Lower values indicate lower genotoxic risk.

defaultOutputs.name: Hepatotox (prob.)
defaultOutputs.tooltip: Hepatotoxicity probability (0-1). Lower values indicate lower liver toxicity risk.

defaultOutputs.name: Skin Sensitization (prob.)
defaultOutputs.tooltip: Skin sensitization probability (0-1). Lower values indicate lower allergenic potential.

defaultOutputs.name: LD₅₀ Oral Rat (mg/kg)
defaultOutputs.tooltip: Lethal dose 50% in rats via oral route (mg/kg). Higher values indicate lower acute toxicity.

defaultOutputs.name: Max Daily Intake (mg/day)
defaultOutputs.tooltip: Maximum recommended daily intake in mg/day (mock data).

configSchema.label: Model
configSchema.tooltip:
Choose which ADMET prediction model to use:

- **SwissADME**: Best for concept-stage screening, medicinal chemistry intuition, fast triage
- **ADMET-AI**: Best for predictive modeling, prioritization, portfolio ranking, data science pipelines
- **preADMET**: Best for cross-checking, academic comparability, legacy workflows

configSchema.label: hERG IC₅₀ Range (µM)
configSchema.tooltip: hERG channel IC₅₀ range (min - max µM). Values below 10 µM indicate cardiac risk.

configSchema.label: Ames Probability Range
configSchema.tooltip: Ames test probability range (0-1). Values above 0.5 indicate mutagenic potential.

configSchema.label: Hepatotox Probability Range
configSchema.tooltip: Hepatotoxicity probability range (0-1). Values above 0.6 indicate liver toxicity risk.

configSchema.label: Skin Sensitization Range
configSchema.tooltip: Skin sensitization probability range (0-1). Values above 0.5 indicate allergenic potential.

configSchema.label: LD₅₀ Range (mg/kg)
configSchema.tooltip: LD₅₀ threshold range (mg/kg). Values below 500 indicate high acute toxicity.
